channel.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
channel.description:
I would like some online tutorials and some reccommendations for books on C and ASM please.I want to create cheats for games other than runescape,which will take a long time...
[b]If ASM is unlearnable at my newby stage then please just post some references to it,thank you.[/b]
(PS. So far in java(just thought youd like to know) I can understand basic bits of code,but writing my own code will have some reference to a book as I cannot memorize the java code yet.I'm working on a digital teacher,which relies heavily on the 'if' bit of code,just finding out how to pop in into a JFrame.)
Thanks for your time.

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

He’s saying that after you’ve learned something like java, you aren’t really gonna have the motivation to learn ASM. If you really wanna learn it, go for it, but it will take alot.

Read full topic

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

ASM is harder than any other, if your interested in it, and commited, I would say learn it FIRST. It will take you more work, and longer to learn, but once you learn a higher level language, I doubt you would go back to learn ASM.

Read full topic
item.source: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“the one, post:26, topic:12180”]Its alright.
Krichevosky, you said that masta’s tutorials are more game hacking oriented, is the link there already or could you post a link to them please, thank you.[/quote]

If you follow that link, you will see a table titled “masta’s original tutorials” above the one titled “Iczelion’s tutorial Series”

Zach1188:

So there’s a basic assembly? I didn’t know.

There’s “Win32” assembly - that is, writing normal 32-bit Windows programs in assembly, with the ability to use Windows API. It’s very much like a more compact version of C.

Read full topic

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

the one:

PS:I never have put spaces after commas as it isn’t neccsary in Singapore,my homeland.I’ll follow your suggestions, though.

Sorry, didn’t know

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:23, topic:12180”]Who actually knows ASM here? I found basic (Win32) ASM to be just as learnable as C++ (actually, I know more ASM than C++). Guy asked for resources, not opinions on whether or not he should try.

MASM (my favorite assembler)
http://www.masm32.com/

Iczelion’s tutorials
I recommend the ones actually by Iczelion for general stuff, but masta’s are gamehacking oriented.
http://win32assembly.online.fr/tutorials.html[/quote]
So there’s a basic assembly? I didn’t know.

Read full topic

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Who actually knows ASM here? I found basic (Win32) ASM to be just as learnable as C++ (actually, I know more ASM than C++). Guy asked for resources, not opinions on whether or not he should try.

MASM (my favorite assembler)
http://www.masm32.com/

Iczelion’s tutorials
I recommend the ones actually by Iczelion for general stuff, but masta’s are gamehacking oriented.
http://win32assembly.online.fr/tutorials.html

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @the_one1 the one
item.description:
@the_one1 wrote:

I have read books on java, and I can read most programs and pull them apart, but yes, I read a book on ASM and frankly, I almost had to have a brain transplant :).I want to learn C as I like old things, I also want to see how to program outside an OOP. I have borrowed a book on visual basic and delphi, as I want to understand SCAR better.

PS:I never have put spaces after commas as it isn’t neccsary in Singapore,my homeland.I’ll follow your suggestions, though.

Read full topic
item.source: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“the one, post:20, topic:12180”]Thanks pwnd.Your one of those helping me alot.

[quote author=the one link=topic=18067.msg205482#msg205482 date=1157142882]
I would like some online tutorials and some reccommendations for books on C and ASMplease.[/quote]

I’m asking for reccomendations,so that I know which sites and books are good for learning and which are bad…

Frank_,I respect you and all,and so,I’ll stop this flame war.I was trying to get reccomendations,but if you think that I’m too lazy to search,I have nothing to say,its your opinion.
Frank_,sorry for sounding rude,I know you are a great coder.[/quote]
Erm… That wasn’t much of a flame war, learn C++ (not C), and please put spaces after your commas.

Honestly you shouldn’t even bother attempting to learn assembly right now, learn some other languages first. ASM is very difficult to learn, very difficult to remember (even for professionals), a pain in the ass, and overall not worth it unless you’re wanting to make drivers for hardware.

So I think either C++ or Java would be the way to go, but I still think you should practice with VB first. People have a much higher success rate when they try to learn an easier language first. Most people who try to head strait for C/C++ fail miserably.

Read full topic

item.title: I would like to request for learning material for C and ASM
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“the one, post:17, topic:12180”]Im not critising,but won’t you give anyone a decent chance?

Furthermore,its already stated in my post that if your opinion is that I’m too newby,just help give some advice or some references,if you have any.I’m not saying I have the capacity to pick up ASM in 10 minutes,I’m just gathering resources to refer to when I am advanced enough.

And,if you ask why I want to gather resources now instead of later,I want to clarify that its better to get some resources first than to ask when everyone has deleted their resources when I ask later,thank you for understanding.

Could anyone provide some resources to C?[/quote]you are allowed to search for youself you know.

Read full topic
